Key Arguments: The bill is clumsily drafted and anti-science.
It allows bureaucrats or government-nominated authorities to determine what information is correct, which could lead to self-censorship and suppression of open discourse.
The bill endangers democratic values, including intellectual freedom and freedom of expression.
It is reminiscent of Orwellian control over information.
There are significant challenges in defining misinformation and disinformation due to the evolving nature of scientific knowledge and technological advances.
Notable Quotes: The bill as it seems to me is clumsily drafted and extremely anti-science.
